questions.question: Who was the Roman ruler who issued the decree that a census of the entire Roman world be taken?

choices.answer: Herod the Great
Claudius Caesar
Caesar Augustus
Julius Caesar

questions.question: Why did the census disrupt the entire Roman world?

choices.answer: People couldn't read or write.
Roman soldiers were everywhere.
The forms were long and hard to complete.
Everyone had to travel to their own town to register.

questions.question: Why did Mary and Joseph have to travel to Bethlehem to register for the census?

choices.answer: They were both of the line of King David.
They were both born in Bethlehem.
The Romans forced them to leave Nazareth.
Bethlehem was the nearest large town.

questions.question: About 700 years before ....... prophesied that Jesus (The Messiah) would be born to a virgin.

choices.answer: Ezekiel
Jeremiah
Isaiah
Daniel

questions.question: Where was Jesus born?

choices.answer: A stable in Nazareth
A stable in Bethlehem.
An inn in Bethlehem.
A palace in Jerusalem.

questions.question: When was Jesus born?

choices.answer: 24th December
25th December
Christmas day
The Bible does not say.

questions.question: Who were the first people (after Mary and Joseph) to know that Jesus had been born?

choices.answer: the disciples
the wise men
shepherds
King Herod

questions.question: What didn't the angel say to the shepherds?

choices.answer: Do not be afraid. I have good news of great joy.
Today in David's town a Saviour is born to you.
Glory to God in the highest & peace on earth.
Leave your sheep, go to Bethlehem, see  the Saviour.

questions.question: What did the shepherds do once the angels left?

choices.answer: Left their sheep and hurried off to find the baby.
Praised God saying wonderful things about him.
Ran around telling everyone what the angels had said.
Hurried into Jerusalem and searched until they found Jesus.

questions.question: Why did the wise men travel to Jerusalem?

choices.answer: They thought a king would be born in a palace.
The star led them to Jerusalem.
The angels sent them there.
Writings said a child born to be king of the Jews was there.

questions.question: How many wise men were there?

choices.answer: The Bible doesn't say.

questions.question: How did King Herod know where Jesus would be born?

choices.answer: He read it in the scriptures.
He had been expecting Jesus to be born.
He asked the wise men.
Chief priests and teachers of the law told him.

questions.question: Why did Herod secretly call the wise men?

choices.answer: He wanted to know how they found out about Jesus.
He wanted them to find Jesus so he could kill him.
He wanted to worship Jesus too.
He had no idea where Jesus was.

questions.question: What gifts did the wise men bring Jesus?

choices.answer: Diamonds, emeralds and sapphires.
Gold, silver and bronze.
Gold, frankincense and myrrh
Special herbs and spices

questions.question: Why didn't the wise men return to King Herod in Jerusalem?

choices.answer: They didn't trust King Herod.
Mary and Joseph warned them not to go back to King Herod
They were warned in a dream not to return to  Herod.
They were in a hurry and took the shortest way home.

questions.question: When and where did the wise men visit Jesus?

choices.answer: A stable in Bethlehem on the night of Jesus' birth.
A house in Bethlehem up to two years later.
A stable in Bethlehem on the 25th of December, 1 A.D.
An inn in Bethlehem after the shepherds had left.

questions.question: Why did Joseph take his family and flee to Egypt?

choices.answer: There was a famine in Israel
An angel warned Joseph in a dream to flee  from Herod.
The Roman emperor Augustus Caesar was searching for Jesus.
The wise men told Joseph that Herod was seeking Jesus.

questions.question: When Herod found out that the wise men had tricked him, he ........

choices.answer: had all babies under 2 in Israel killed.
ordered his soldiers to kill the wise men.
had all the baby boys under 2 in or near Bethlehem killed.
searched Bethlehem from top to bottom.

questions.question: When was the first Christmas celebrated?

choices.answer: 1 A.D on the night of Jesus' birth.
70 A.D. after the fall of Jerusalem.
25th December 336 A.D. during reign of Emperor Constantine.
25th December 1896 A.D.

questions.question: Why do we have Christmas trees at Christmas time?

choices.answer: They are a pagan decoration put up for the winter solstice.
They are a reminder of the cross of Jesus.
It gives somewhere to hang decorations.
Christians use it as a sign of everlasting life with God.

questions.question: Where did the legend of Father Christmas come from?

choices.answer: Coca Cola dressed Father Christmas in red to sell its drink.
American malls in the 1820s used Santa Claus to sell gifts.
A pious and kind monk named St Nicholas born around 230 A.D.
A generous reindeer herder in northern Russia

questions.question: Where did the idea of Christmas presents come from?

choices.answer: A reminder of God's gift & the gifts given by the wise men.
Shops wanted to make money from the Christmas season.
Pagan tradition of giving presents on the winter solstice.
Santa Claus delivered presents by a reindeer drawn sleigh.

questions.question: When was the carol Silent Night written?
When was the first NZ Christmas?

choices.answer: Stanley Qiu, Central Otago,   25th December, 1886.
George Grey preached. Waitangi, 25th December 1840.
Samuel Marsden preached. Bay of Islands, 25th December 1814.
Captain Cook, Young Nick's Head, 25th December 1769.

questions.question: In which of the gospels would you find the Christmas accounts.

choices.answer: Matthew
Mark
Luke
John

questions.question: Why do people celebrate Christmas today?

choices.answer: A time for family, fun and friends.
To remember the birth of Jesus.
A time to give presents.
It is a public holiday.
